intro: Nothocallitris, commonly known as the coastal heath or coastal callitris, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Myrtaceae. It is native to Australia, particularly the coastal regions of Western Australia and southern South Australia. The plants are typically shrubs or small trees, characterized by their dense, compact growth and leathery, aromatic leaves. They are adapted to arid and saline environments, often growing in coastal dunes or sandy soils. Nothocallitris species are known for their resilience to harsh conditions and their role in stabilizing coastal ecosystems.
